content.question: A <math alttext="163" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>163</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> square-kilometer (<math alttext="kilometers squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>km</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>) small island is found <math alttext="2,000 kilometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>km</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mainland. A second, larger, <math alttext="230,000 square-kilometer" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>230</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mtext>km</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> island is found <math alttext="1,000 kilometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>km</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> from the mainland. Based on the theory of island biogeography, which of the following statements is most likely true about the small island when compared with the large island?

choices.label: The rate of immigration is lower for the small island than for the large island.
The small island has niches that are more like the mainland than the large island.
The small island has more available resources than the large island.
The rate of species extinction is lower on the small island than on the large island.

content.answer: The rate of immigration is lower for the small island than for the large island.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
